description: Chronological or sequential visualization showing evolution, progression, or stages. Works well for tracing how concepts, ideas, or arguments develop over time or across phases.

input_data_schema.description: Array of chronologically-ordered entries. Each entry represents a point on the timeline.

label.description: Display label for this timeline node (phase name, event title, etc.)

date.description: Chronological position — year as number or ISO date string

description.description: Body text for this timeline entry

category.description: Categorical grouping (e.g. idea form type, phase type) — used for color-coding

badges.description: Short chip labels (e.g. vocabulary terms, tags)

group.description: Grouping key when multiple timelines are shown (e.g. per-idea grouping)

metadata.description: Arbitrary extra fields the consumer renderer may use

vertical_evolution.description: Vertical per-idea evolution timeline with vocabulary chips and phase labels. Gradient connector from past (gray) to present (crimson).
vertical_evolution.example_use: Idea evolution across works in genealogy analysis

horizontal_bifurcation.description: Horizontal timeline marking key turning points with year pips. Minimal, emphasizes temporal distance between events.

concept_drift.description: Vertical timeline tracking how a single concept's meaning shifts across contexts or periods.
concept_drift.example_use: Semantic drift of a term across authors or periods

group_by.description: Field to group entries by (produces multiple parallel timelines)
